currently signed with Streamline/Interscope--> }} }} '''Wanessa Godói Camargo Buaiz''' (born December 28, 1982), commonly known as '''Wanessa Camargo''', is a [[Brazil]]ian [[singer]] and [[songwriter]].<ref>[http://g1.globo.com/musica/blog/mauro-ferreira/post/album-sertanejo-de-wanessa-volta-com-bonus-e-o-mesmo-tom-artificial.html Álbum sertanejo de Wanessa Camargo volta com bônus e o mesmo tom artificial] Ferreira, Mauro. ''[[G1 (website)|G1]]''.</ref> She is the daughter of Brazilian [[Música sertaneja|sertanejo]] singer Zezé Di Camargo from the duo [[Zezé Di Camargo & Luciano]] and of the businesswoman Zilú Godói. Before the race like singer, during the decade of 1990, integrated the Brazilian version of the musical [[Cats (musical)|Cats]] and was part of the group of dancers of the pair Zezé Di Camargo and Luciano.<ref name=gambare/> In 2000 she signed with [[Sony BMG|BMG]] and released her debut [[studio album]], the homonym ''[[Wanessa Camargo (2000 album)|Wanessa Camargo]]'', betting on a [[country music|country]]-focused musical style and selling 150,000 copies<ref name="wc1">[http://www.victoriahaus.com/2016/02/17/wanessa-acustico-na-vic-show-especial-da-era-wanessa-camargo-ao-xainiron/ Wanessa Camargo apresenta show acústico na Victoria Haus] Victoria Haus</ref> with the singles "O Amor não Deixa", "Enamorado por Você" and "Eu Posso Te Sentir." In 2001, she released her second album of the same name, ''[[Wanessa Camargo (2001 album)|Wanessa Camargo]]'', releasing to the radio stations "Eu Posso Te Sentir", "Tanta Saudade" and "Gostar de Mim". In 2002, she accepted the invitation to become a presenter of the Young Evening program at [[Rede Globo]], where she will stay for two years. In the same year she won recognition with the track "Sem Querer" on the third album of the same name, ''[[Wanessa Camargo (2002 album)|Wanessa Camargo]]''.
In 2004, she released the first live album, ''Transparente Ao Vivo'', and joined the cast of the fourth season of the series ''Sítio do Picapau Amarelo''. In 2005 she signed with [[Sony Music|Sony]] and underwent a reformulation with the release of the album ''[[W (Wanessa album)|W]]'', adhering to [[dance-pop]] music and composing eleven of the fifteen songs, being her most authorial work. In this project were withdrawn their singles of greater success in the race, "Amor, Amor" and "Não Resisto a Nós Dois", in addition to the promotional ones "Relaxa" e "Culpada", that gained good repercussion in radios.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://wanessa.uol.com.br/2010/discografia.php|título=álbum W marca o maior momento da carreira de Wanessa|date=3 July 2015|work=Uol}}</ref> In 2007, she adopted the stage name of Wanessa, leaving her surname aside, and released the album ''[[Total (Wanessa album)|Total]]'', which sold 100,000 copies, marked by the track "Me Abrace". In 2009 she released her first song in [[English-language|English]], "Fly", with rapper Ja Rule, present on her sixth album, titled ''[[Meu Momento]]''. In 2010 she decided to dedicate herself to [[electronic music]], releasing the [[extended play|EP]] ''[[Você não Perde por Esperar]]'', and in 2011 she released the album ''[[DNA (Wanessa album)|DNA]]'', with songs entirely in English.
In 2016, five years after its last studio album, announces that it was redirecting its race to songs of the [[Música sertaneja|sertanejo]] genre. On August 19 she released her eighth studio album for streaming, entitled ''[[33 (Wanessa album)|33]]''.<ref>{{citar web|URL=https://portalfreakout.com.br/site/escute-o-album-sertanejo-de-wanessa-camargo-na-integra/|title=Escute o álbum sertanejo de Wanessa Camargo na íntegra|publicado=Portal Freak Out|date=3 July 2015}}</ref>
==Biography== Wanessa was born in [[Goiânia]], state of [[Goiás]], on December 28, 1982. She is the daughter of the Brazilian [[Música sertaneja|sertanejo]] singer Zezé Di Camargo from the duo [[Zezé Di Camargo & Luciano]] and of the businesswoman Zilú Godói. She attended public schools during her childhood, but she had no toys because of the financial difficulties of her family. In 1991, to the 9 years, moved to [[São Paulo (city)|São Paulo]] when her father Zezé di Camargo and her uncle Luciano Camargo went in search of the success.<ref name="Veja 2003">{{citar web|url =http://veja.abril.com.br/260203/entrevista.html|title=Entrevista com Wanessa Camargo: "Sou o oposto da Sandy" |work=Veja|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In 1992 she was enrolled in a [[private school]] as soon as her parents began to have a better social condition, but suffered prejudice from colleagues and employees because she was not upper class.<ref name="Veja 2003"/> During an interview for ''[[Veja (magazine)|Veja]]'', Wanessa said: "The principal of the school was always insinuating that we would not pay the college. She humiliated us, but I was so insecure that I never told this to my parents. , and even that was a mockery. Once, to make me happy, my father took a borrowed lance just to give me the taste of going to the car class."<ref name="Veja 2003"/>
Also in 1991 mounted a youth band along with its three best friends Kiko, Leandro and Bruno, that in the future would form the group [[KLB]].<ref name=ficha>{{citar web|url=http://www.ofuxico.com.br/noticias-sobre-famosos/ficha-wanessa-camargo/2005/12/25-15205.html|title=Ficha: Wanessa Camargo|work=O Fuxico|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> The group, where the boys played the instruments and Wanessa was the lead singer, The band's first name was ''The Fenders'', a reference to the brand of guitar, then changed to ''Neon'' and started performing at clubs and parties, making versions of songs of [[Xuxa]] and [[Leandro & Leonardo]].<ref>{{citar web|url=http://guiadoscuriosos.com.br/categorias/4640/1/bandas-pop.html|title=5. KLB|work=Guia dos Curiosos|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In 1993, at the age of ten, she began to study [[theater]], [[ballet]] and [[tap dance]], improving over time her teachings in dance in the [[street dance]] mode.<ref name=gambare>{{citar web|url=http://gambare.uol.com.br/2007/05/17/wanessa-camargo-artista-desde-cedo/|title=Wanessa Camargo: artista desde cedo: A bela sobe no altar neste mês de maio|work=UOL|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In adolescence it began to do [[gymnastics]] and [[artistic gymnastics]] to gain physical fitness when dancing. In 1995 it debuted in the theater when participating in the musical [[Cats (musical)|Cats]].<ref name=gambare/> In 1996 it began to integrate the body of dancers of the duo Zezé Di Camargo and Luciano.
==Career== ===2000-02: First albums=== At the end of 1999 Wanessa sends some [[Demo (music)|demos]] for the [[Sony BMG|BMG]], being contracted by the label the following year, when it began to work in its first album.<ref name=uol00>{{citar web|url=http://celebridades.uol.com.br/album/wanessa-camargo_album.htm#fotoNav=1|title=WC 2000: (2/8/2000)|work=UOL|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On November 11, 2000, her debut single, "O Amor não Deixa", was released.<ref name=resenhando>{{citar web|url=http://www.resenhando.com/2014/08/entrevista-com-wanessa-camargo-cantora.html|title="Quem não gostar, só tem que respeitar" - Wanessa Camargo|published=Resenhando|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On December 12, Wanessa releases her [[wikt:debut|debut album]], the homonym ''[[Wanessa Camargo (2000 album)|Wanessa Camargo]]'', focused on [[country pop]] with romantic compositions, bought from foreign musicians and adapted by the team of the label for the [[Portuguese language]], in addition to a written by the singer herself "Eu Nasci pra Amar Você" - dedicated to her boyfriend at the time, [[Dado Dolabella]].<ref>{{citar web |url=http://metropole.rac.com.br/_conteudo/2012/10/capa/4315-m-e-cheia-de-g-s.html|title=Wanessa Camargo entrevista|work=Diário de Cuiabá|access-date=2018-02-02|autor=}}</ref> Due to the good reception of her first song, "Apaixonada por Você", which had been chosen as second single, gained a new clothes before arriving the radios, changing the rhythm most dancing for a slower and melodic [[country music|country]] version, adjusting itself the previous one.<ref>{{citar web |url=http://www.diariodecuiaba.com.br/detalhe.php?cod=64576|title=Wanessa Camargo grava clipe em Cuiabá|work=Diário de Cuiabá|author=Joanice Pierini|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> The new version was released on February 12, 2001 and was included in the soundtrack of the novel ''Um Anjo Caiu do Céu''.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.radio.uol.com.br/#/letras-e-musicas/wanessa-camargo/apaixonada-por-voce-versao-um-anjo-caiu-do-ceu/998297|title=Um Anjo Caiu do Céu - Wanessa Camargo|work=UOL|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> The album was re-released with the new version of the track included on February 15.<ref>{{citar web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Wanessa-Camargo/dp/B00006LW2A/ref=sr_1_7?ie=UTF8&s=music&qid=1254840910&sr=1-7|title=Amazon.com:Wanessa Camargo: Wanessa Camargo: Music|published=Amazon|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In all, she sold 200,000 copies.<ref name=praiagrande>{{citar web |url=http://www.praiagrande.sp.gov.br/Praiagrande/noticia_01.asp?cod=3395&cd_categoria=|title=O Show do Verão é Você-Wanessa Camargo é a atração de sábado|author=João Carlos Miranda|work=Praia Grande Website|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In the same vein as the previous ones, the third and last single, "Eu Posso Te Sentir", version of "[[Breathe (Faith Hill song)|Breath]]", of [[Faith Hill]] is released on July 30.<ref name=wanessacamargonews.com>{{citar web|url=http://www.wanessacamargonews.com/biografia.php|title= Biografia|access-date=2018-02-02|work=Wanessa Camargo News}}</ref>
In 2001 Wanessa makes its debut like actress in the children's film ''[[Xuxa e os Duendes]]'', interpreting the fairy Mel, in addition to recording the track "Tudo Que Você Sonhar" for the [[Xuxa e os Duendes (soundtrack)|soundtrack]].<ref>{{citar web |url=http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/folha/ilustrada/critica/ult569u488.shtml|title="Xuxa e os Duendes" resgata imaginário infantil |work=Folha de S.Paulo|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On October 25 is released the first single from her second album, "Eu Quero Ser o Seu Amor", differentiating itself from previous ones by betting on a more danceable [[pop rock]] and with the [[music video]] inspired by [[video games]].<ref>{{citar web |url=http://quem.globo.com/edic/20011108/rep_dado.htm|title=Dado Dolabella, o gato da vez|work=Globo|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On November 9 her second album, titled ''[[Wanessa Camargo (2001 album)|Wanessa Camargo]]'' again, is released and following the same line of the previous one and with the track "Vou Gritar Seu Nome" composed by her.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/wanessa-camargo-2001-mw0000342195|title=WC 2001|work=Allmusic|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On February 21, 2002, the second single "Tanta Saudade" was released, which featured as backinig vocals her father, Zezé Di Camargo.<ref name="wanessacamargonews.com" /> The last single of the project, "Gostar de Mim", finalized the work in the album, that sold 300,000 copies.<ref name=praiagrande/> In July it records the short film ''Socialmente Correto'' next to Oscar Magrini, however the project ended up being canceled.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.terra.com.br/exclusivo/noticias/2002/07/05/023.htm|title=Oscar Magrini dá dicas de interpretação para Wanessa Camargo|work=Terra|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref>
In September, she accepted the invitation of the director Marlene Mattos to become a presenter of a special of end of year on the [[Jovem Guarda]], titled ''Jovens Tardes'', next to the group KLB, of the pair Pedro and Thiago and the singer Fael Mondego.<ref name=jt0101>{{citar web|url=http://www.terra.com.br/exclusivo/noticias/2002/10/24/033.htm|title=Jovens Tardes estréia com homenagem a Jovem Guarda|author= |work=Terra|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> The special aired from October and brought the presenters playing the songs of the time with their respective original artists.<ref name=jt0101/> On November 30, 2002, the single "Um Dia ... Meu Primeiro Amor" was released, and on December 2, their third album.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/wanessa-camargo-2002-mw0000698822|title=WC 2002|work=Allmusic|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On February 22, 2003 is released the second single, the pop rock "Sem Querer", that brought a music video with Erik Marmo.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://celebridades.uol.com.br/album/wanessa-camargo_album.htm#fotoNav=10|title=WC 2002 (2/12/2002)|work=UOL|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> The last single of the album was chosen by a vote of the site of the singer, having as options the dance "Paga Pra Ver (Tô Pagando Pra Ver)" and the country "Filme de Amor" - that was chosen and launched officially.<ref>{{citar web |url=http://www.grupodiferente.com.br/index.php/artistas-nacionais/2436-wanessa-camargo|title=Wanessa Camargo|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref>
===2003-04: ''Transparente'' and television=== [[File:Wanessa Camargo On Stage 2.jpg|thumbnail|160px|left|Wanessa performing in 2004.]] In March 2003, due to the good reception of the special of the end of the year, the ''Jovens Tardes'' became a fixed program in the grid of the station, being presented weekly on Sundays afternoon with the same presenters, besides the inclusion of Luiza Possi, being each program began to focus on a different theme, such as [[rock music|rock]], film classics and novel themes, bringing special guests to play them.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.diariodecuiaba.com.br/detalhe.php?cod=126935|title=Luiza Possi comandará “Jovens Tardes”|work=Diário de Cuiabá|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref><ref>{{citar web|url=http://cultura.estadao.com.br/noticias/geral,jovens-tardes-pode-emplacar-na-grade-global,20030107p2371|title="Jovens Tardes" pode emplacar na grade global|work=Estadão|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In this time was scaled to interpret the main personage of the short film ''S.O.S Cupido'', however the project was only in the script and never got to be recorded. After spending the year dedicated to the program, on September 20 the singer recorded her first DVD in [[Rio de Janeiro]].<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.terra.com.br/exclusivo/noticias/2003/05/14/022.htm|title=Wanessa atuará em filme S.O.S Cupido|work=Terra|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref><ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.ofuxico.com.br/noticias-sobre-famosos/wanessa-responde-a-perguntas-dos-fas-no-fuxico/2009/11/27-89383.html|title=Wanessa responde a perguntas dos fãs no Fuxico|work=O Fuxico|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> For the new project Wanessa underwent a reformulation of visual, giving to clothes more sensual and red hair with bangs to mature her image before the public.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://diversao.terra.com.br/gente/noticias/0,,OI3523193-EI13419,00-Wanessa+maltrata+com+visual+sado+na+VIP.html|title=Wanessa "maltrata" com visual sado na VIP|work=Terra|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In December she poses for a semi-naked rehearsal in ''VIP'' magazine, in addition to giving interviews on sex and taboo subjects, reinforcing the idea that had grown up.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://diversao.terra.com.br/gente/noticias/0,,OI3523197-EI13419,00-Eu+sei+ser+bem+sensual+diz+Wanessa+Camargo.html|title="Eu sei ser bem sensual", diz Wanessa Camargo|work=Terra|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref>
On January 11, 2004 the ''Jovens Tardes'' comes to an end with the departure of director Marlene Mattos of the station - who even offered a solo program for Wanessa in the [[Rede Bandeirantes]], which she refused, claiming that she would return to focus on music.<ref name=uol11>{{citar web|url=http://virgula.uol.com.br/famosos/marlene-mattos-nao-leva-wanessa-para-band|title=Marlene Mattos não leva Wanessa para Band|work=UOL|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In February she joined the main cast of the fourth season of the children's show ''Sítio do Picapau Amarelo'', where she played the rock star Diana Dechamps, remaining in this until the end of that year, being her most expressive work as an actress.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://babado.ig.com.br/materias/182001-182500/182318/182318_1.html|title=Wanessa Camargo e Supla vivem casal apaixonado no Sítio|work=IG|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On March 12, she released her new single, "Me Engana que I Gosto", version of "Miénteme", by Puerto Rican singer [[:es:Olga Tañón|Olga Tañón]], showing a big difference from previous work not to launch a country-focused flagship.<ref>{{citar web |url=http://revistaquem.globo.com/Quem/0,6993,EQG797441-2157,00.html|title=Wanessa Camargo: Pobre menina rica|work=[[Quem]]|published ==[[Globo.com]]|author==Guilherme Ravache|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On May 24 she released her first live album entitled ''Transparente Ao Vivo'', which featured four new songs and their previous hits.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://babado.ig.com.br/materias/184501-185000/184985/184985_1.html|title=Wanessa lança primeiro DVD|published=IG|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In July carries out tests for the ''[[América (telenovela)|América]]'' novel, of [[Glória Perez]], that would debut next year, but ended up not happening.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://exclusivo.terra.com.br/interna/0,,OI348325-EI1118,00-Wanessa+Camargo+faz+testes+para+America.html|title=Wanessa Camargo faz testes para "América"|published=Terra|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In the same month made a special participation in the children's film ''Cine Gibi'', of the ''[[Monica's Gang]]'', interpreting itself and opposite with the animations.<ref>{{citar web|url=https://omelete.uol.com.br/filmes/criticas/cinegibi-o-filme-turma-da-monica/?key=23089|title= Cinegibi, O Filme - Turma da Mônica (2004)|published=UOL|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref>
On October 12 she released the second single from the live work, "Metade de Mim", which brought a music video where the singer appears naked and in bed with the Roque Arrais model.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://revistaquem.globo.com/EditoraGlobo/componentes/article/edg_article_print/0,3916,813842-3028-3,00.html|title=PAIXÃO PLATÔNICA|work=Revista Quem|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref><ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.terra.com.br/istoegente/265/urgente/urgente_04.htm|title= O beijo técnico de Wanessa Camargo|published=Terra|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In December she stars in the second season of the reality show ''Quebrando a Rotina'' with to [[Felipe Dylon]], traveling with him and hosted by [[Luciano Huck]] in a trailer between the south coast of Rio de Janeiro and the north coast of São Paulo.<ref name="musicade1">{{citar web |url=http://www.musicade.net/video/wanessa-quebrando-a-rotina-episdio-1_U4SZHHZgOLk/|title=Quebrando A Rotina - Episódio 1|work=Música DE|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> The two wrote and interpreted together the track "Amor de Praia" at the end of the season.<ref name="musicade1"/> Also that year was invited to the film 2 Children of Francisco, that would tell the history of its family, but it refused.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.gazetadigital.com.br/conteudo/imprimir/secao/58/materia/38276|title=Wanessa pode estrear como atriz de cinema e novela|published=Gazeta Digital|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In 2005 she starred in her second reality show, ''Subindo a Serra'', alongside Felipe Dylon, [[Karina Bacchi]], [[Preta Gil]] and [[Popó]], accompanying their lives during a trip to [[Teresópolis]], in Rio de Janeiro.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.ofuxico.com.br/noticias-sobre-famosos/luciano-huck-estreia-seu-subindo-a-serra/2005/09/10-8418.html|title=Luciano Huck estreia seu Subindo a Serra|published=O Fuxico|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref>
===2005–09: ''W'', ''Total'' and ''Meu Momento''=== [[File:Wanessa Camargo 2006.jpg|thumbnail|150px|right|Wanessa sings "Meu Menino" on ''W in Tour... Era Uma Vez'' in 2006.]] On June 11, 2005, she released her new single, "Amor, Amor", presenting a totally different sound from the proposal until then, betting on [[Latin pop]] and [[dance-pop]] and being compared to the works of Colombian singer [[Shakira]], becoming the second song of the greatest repercussion of her career.<ref>{{Citation |work= Letras de Músicas | url = http://shakira.letrasdemusicas.com.br/biografia.html |title= Shakira|access-date=2018-02-02 }}</ref> On August 8, she released her fourth studio album, ''[[W (Wanessa Camargo album)|W]]'', which was distinguished from previous by the absence of [[country music|country]] elements, betting genuinely [[Pop music|pop]] and [[pop rock]] songs, being her most authorial work with ten of the fifteen songs composed by Wanessa.<ref>{{Citar web | url = http://opiniaoweb.com/portal/biografia-da-cantora-wanessa-camargo/ |published= Opinião Web | title= Biografia da cantora Wanessa Camargo |access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> ''W'' W was also her most well-received album by critics, who noticed its maturation and originality when printing a brand of its own, disentangling the image of those who replicated what had already been done.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.resenhando.com/2014/08/entrevista-com-wanessa-camargo-cantora.html|title=Entrevista com Wanessa Camargo|published=Resenhando|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On January 10, 2006, the second single, "Não Resisto a Nós Dois" was released, which became the song of greatest repercussion of her career, being the seventh more heard in the Brazilian radios that year.<ref>{{Citar web | url = http://acidglam.com/sodapop/?p=633 | title= Acid Glam |access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In February, she premiered the ''W in Tour ... Era Una Vez'', her biggest repercussion tour, directed by [[Marília Pêra]] with five blocks of sets and costume changes.<ref name="ReferenceA">{{Citar web | url = http://www.wanessacamargonews.com/wintour.php | published = Wanessa Camargo News | title = Wintour |access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref>
The tour brought an unprecedented proposition by bringing together music and theater, inspired by [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] musicals, with Wanessa playing a character while singing.<ref name="ReferenceA"/> On August 22, 2006, the third single "Louca" was released, chosen by the public through a vote on its website in the contest with "Meu Menino" and the new version of "Festa na Floresta", which had won a remix with the participation of rapper C4bal.<ref name=uolouca>{{Citar web | url =http://tc.batepapo.uol.com.br/convidados/arquivo/musica/cantora-wanessa-camargo-comentou-o-lancamento-da-faixa-louca-do-cd-w.jhtm|title=Cantora fala sobre o lançamento da faixa "Louca", de seu mais recente CD, "W". Wanessa Camargo conta também como está se preparando para participar da segunda edição do quadro "Dança no Gelo", do Domingão do Faustão| published =UOL |access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> In September Wanessa would participate in the talent show ''[[Ice dancing]]'', but ended up twisting her foot a week before the debut and had to give up.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://exclusivo.terra.com.br/interna/0,,OI1145491-EI1118,00.html|title=Wanessa Camargo se machuca e está fora da Dança no Gelo|published=Terra|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On August 2, 2007, after spending the year working on their new album, Wanessa released the single "Não Tô Pronta Pra Perdoar", a version of the song "[[Not Ready to Make Nice]]" by the [[Dixie Chicks]] group.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.territoriodamusica.com/canalpop/noticias/?c=13503|title=Wanessa Camargo lança novo álbum este mês|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> On August 21, her fifth studio album, ''[[Total (Wanessa album)|Total]]'', was released, mixing the dancing pop that had joined the last album with country pop.''country pop''.<ref>{{citar web | url=http://musica.uol.com.br/ultnot/2007/08/24/ult89u7903.jhtm|title=Bate-papo: Wanessa Camargo não tem medo de soar ridícula ao falar de amor em suas canções|work=UOL|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> The album sold a total of 100,000 copies.<ref>{{citar web | url = http://revistaquem.globo.com/Revista/Quem/0,,EMI21852-9531,00.html | title = Wanessa Camargo recebe disco de ouro e de platina|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref>
On April 17, Total Tour begins at [[Citibank Hall (São Paulo)|Citibank Hall]], in São Paulo, which had one of the shows recorded for release on DVD, although this has never happened.<ref>{{citar web | url = http://revistaquem.globo.com/Revista/Quem/0,,EMI21852-9531,00.html | title = Wanessa Camargo recebe disco de ouro e de platina |accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> Wanessa still had not decided for the second single when it was contacted by the Mexican band [[Camila (band)|Camila]] so that they recorded together a Hispano-Portuguese version of "[[Abrázame (song)|Abrázame]]" - which she had totally rewritten in Portuguese.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://rollingstone.uol.com.br/edicao/18/hola-camila|title=Revelação do México, Camila aporta no Brasil|work=Rolling Stones|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> "Me Abrace" was released on May 14, 2008, serving as a single for the Brazilian version of ''[[Todo Cambió]]'' and the re-release of the album ''[[Meu Momento]]''.<ref>{{citar web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/br/album/abrazame-me-abrace-single/id321896722|title=Revelação do México, Camila aposta no Brasil|work=Mauro Ferreira Site|acessodata=23 de junho de 2017}}</ref> In 2009 the singer happens to sign just like Wanessa - without her last name - from the single "[[Fly (Wanessa song)|Fly]]", released on April 7, which counted on the participation American rapper [[Ja Rule]].<ref>{{citar web | url=http://www.mundodanet.com/ouvir-novo-musica-wanessa-camargo-fly/|título=Ouvir novo música Wanessa Camargo – Fly|work=Mundo Net|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> On June 1, the sixth studio album ''[[Meu Momento]]'' is released, bringing the collaboration of Rita Lee]] and Alexandre Carlo and showing a new aspect when betting on [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] and [[Urban contemporary|Urban]] genres.<ref>{{citar web | url=http://revistacrescer.globo.com/Revista/Crescer/0,,EMI67112-15565,00-WANESSA+CAMARGO+DESFILA+NOVO+VISUAL.html|title=Wanessa Camargo desfila novo visual|work=Globo|access-date=2018-02-02}}</ref> The second single, "[[Não Me Leve a Mal (Let me Live)|Não Me Leve a Mal]]", was chosen through a [[Twitter]] vote of the singer, being released on September 28.<ref>{{citar web |url=http://ego.globo.com/Gente/Noticias/0,,MUL1265612-9798,00-NOVA+MUSICA+DE+TRABALHO+DE+WANESSA+CAMARGO+FOI+ESCOLHIDA+NO+TWITTER.html|title= Nova música de trabalho de Wanessa Camargo foi escolhida no Twitter |date= |accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> Despite the investments, which included the opening of [[Beyoncé]]'s show in Brazil, the album sold only 20,000 copies.<ref name="momento">{{citar web |url=http://portalpopline.com.br/voce-nao-perde-por-esperar-wanessa-lanca-site-misterioso-e-prepara-nova-musica-de-trabalho/|title=“Você não perde por esperar…”: Wanessa lança site misterioso e prepara nova música de trabalho|work=POPLine|published=[[Grupo Objetivo]]|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref>
===2010–15: ''DNA'' and ''DNA Tour''=== [[File:Wanessa_em_maio_de_2013.jpg |thumbnail|175px|left|Wanessa during the DNA Tour in 2013.]] In 2010 Wanessa announces a reformulation in the race, being directed to [[electronic music]] scene, claiming that it was a world tendency popularized by [[Lady Gaga]] and [[The Black Eyed Peas]].<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.cifraclubnews.com.br/noticias/22293-wanessa-camargo-aposta-na-mosica-eletronica-em-nova-parceria.html|title=Wanessa Camargo aposta na música eletrônica em nova parceria|work=Cifras News|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> In May, she auditioned for the musical ''[[Zorro|A Marca do Zorro]]'', which was approved for the character Luiza, but gave up so that her sister, Camila Camargo, could take the role.<ref>{{citar web | url=http://entretenimento.r7.com/famosos-e-tv/noticias/wanessa-camargo-desiste-de-musical-para-nao-atrapalhar-carreira-da-irma-20100512.html|title=Wanessa Camargo desiste de musical para não atrapalhar carreira da irmã|work=R7|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> On July 1, the track "[[Falling for U|Falling For U]]" by [[DJ]] Mister Jam was released with the participation of the singer's vocals.<ref>{{citar web | url=http://180graus.com/salada/wanessa-vem-com-sua-turne-balada-a-teresina-379853.html|title=Wanessa vem com sua turnê 'Balada' à Teresina|work=180 Graus|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> On September 9, she released the first single from her forthcoming work, "[[Worth It (Wanessa song)|Worth It]]", a version of "[[Beautiful Encounter (Yan Yu)]]", originally recorded by [[Elva Hsiao]].<ref>{{Citar web |url=http://www.cifraclubnews.com.br/noticias/23330-veja-aqui-novo-clipe-de-wanessa-na-integra-worth-it.html |title=Veja aqui o novo clipe de Wanessa na íntegra, "Worth It" - Cifra Club News |work=Cifra Club News |accessdate=2011-02-07 |author=MARQUES, Diego}}</ref> Two days later her first ''[[extended play|EP]]'', ''[[Você não Perde por Esperar]]'', sold through a music ticket - a magnetic card in which the buyers and keyed the code contained in the site of the singer to [[Music download|digital download]] the songs. On March 31 is released last single of the work, "Stuck On Repeat" version of Elle Vee.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://djsound.virgula.uol.com.br/noticias/3213|title=Wanessa grava 4 musicas em ingles|work=Virgula.com|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> At the time, in spite of the directions that would be launched in international career, Wanessa declared that it had no intention.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.yespop.com.br/2011/01/confira-entrevista-da-wanessa-para.html|title=Confira entrevista da Wanessa para Rolling Stone Brasil|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref>
On July 5, 2011, she released her new single, "[[Sticky Dough]]", in collaboration with American rapper Bam Bam, being a version of the original song by Charite Viken. In the same month, on 28th, her seventh studio album, ''[[DNA (Wanessa album)|DNA]]'', recorded totally in [[English-language]] and entirely produced by Mr. Jam, that ended up having the promocion interrupted with the announcement of its pregnancy.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://musica.uol.com.br/ultnot/2011/10/05/wanessa-faz-ultimo-show-gravida-no-dia-29-em-sao-paulo.jhtm|title=Wanessa faz último show grávida no dia 29 de outubro, em São Paulo|work=UOL|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> The title track "DNA" was released as a second single on October 24.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://popline.mtv.uol.com.br/wanessa-anuncia-segundo-single-do-seu-primeiro-album-totalmente-em-ingles|title=Wanessa anuncia segundo single do seu primeiro álbum totalmente em inglês|work=Popline|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> Already the third and last single, "Get Loud!", Was only released only on June 26, 2012 after the singer returned from [[maternity leave]].<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.cifraclubnews.com.br/noticias/38635-wanessa-lanca-tres-remixes-para-sua-nova-musica-de-trabalho-confira.html|title=Wanessa lança três remixes para sua nova música de trabalho|work=Cifra News|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> On December 1, 2012, she released her new song, "[[Hair & Soul]]", having the [[Wella]]-sponsored music video, which Wanessa was a publicity girl.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://popline.mtv.uol.com.br/de-volta-ao-trabalho-wanessa-anuncia-novo-single-e-prepara-gravacao-de-novo-dvd|title=De volta ao trabalho, Wanessa anuncia novo single e prepara gravação de novo DVD|published=Popline|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> On April 17 the second single, "Shine It On" was released and, on the 30th, their live album ''DNA Tour''.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://wanessa.uol.com.br/2013/04/wanessa-lanca-clipe-e-conversa-com-fas-no-canal-vevo/|título=Wanessa lança clipe e conversa com fãs no canal VEVO|published=Wanessa}}</ref> On June 10 she released the track "Amor, Amor". On November 21 is released "[[Turn It Up (Wanessa Camargo song)|Turn It Up]]", with the participation of the American rapper [[Soulja Boy]], as single of the re-launch of the work.<ref>{{citar web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/br/album/wanessa-dna-tour-deluxe-version/id756991377|title=Wanessa - DNA Tour|publicado=iTunes|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> In June 2015 begins the W15 Tour, aiming to celebrate its 15 years of career and bringing in the repertoire its greater successes.<ref>{{citar web|URL=http://www.billboard.com.br/fotos/os-lancamentos-nacionais-mais-esperados-ate-o-fim-de-2015/|title =Anitta, Sandy e Wanessa estão entre os lançamentos mais esperados para 2015 pela Billboard Brasil|work=Billboard Brasil}}</ref>
===2016-17: Reformulation and ''33''=== [[File:DESFILE DAS ESCOLAS DE SAMBA DO GRUPO ESPECIAL NO SAMBÓDROMO DO RIO DE JANEIRO (33126483806).jpg|thumbnail|240px|left|Wanessa parading for the [[Mocidade Independente de Padre Miguel]] in the Carnival 2017.]] At the beginning of 2016 she began recording her eighth studio album, which had begun work in 2015, announcing her departure from the electronic scene for a more commercial pop radio direction for the radio, focusing on Portuguese-language lyrics.<ref>{{citar web|URL=http://epoca.globo.com/colunas-e-blogs/bruno-astuto/noticia/2015/03/e-doloroso-ve-los-separados-mas-apenas-quero-que-se-respeitem-diz-bwanessab-sobre-separacao-de-zeze-e-zilu.html|title ="É doloroso vê-los separados. Apenas quero que se respeitem", diz Wanessa sobre Zezé e Zilu|published=Revista Época|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref><ref>{{citar web|url=http://portalpopline.com.br/wanessa-confirma-lancamento-de-album-novo-para-2015/|title=Wanessa confirma lançamento de álbum novo para 2015|published=Portal Popline|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> Mister Jam and César Lemos were announced as producers and the singer quoted her 2005 album ''[[W (Wanessa album)|W]]'' as well as the tracks "Amor, Amor" and "Sem Querer" as references of the material she was preparing.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://portalpontopop.wixsite.com/pontopop/single-post/2016/05/10/Vem-hit-Wanessa-grava-com-produtor-de-Amor-Amor|title=Vem hit! Wanessa Camargo grava com produtor de "Amor, Amor" e "Sem Querer"|published=Ponto Pop|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> On January 31 it reveals that it would return to use the surname Camargo after 8 years of removing it of the artistic title. On May 17 she announced that she had crated the material she was recording until then and switched the producer team to make a redirection in her career, leaving pop music to focus on [[sertanejo music]] now.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://portalpontopop.wixsite.com/pontopop/single-post/2016/05/26/Sertanejo-Entenda-a-revolta-que-envolveu-a-pr%C3%A9via-da-nova-faixa-de-Wanessa-Camargo|title=Sertanejo? Entenda a revolta que envolveu a prévia da nova faixa de Wanessa Camargo|published=Ponto Pop|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref><ref>{{citar web|url=http://portalpopline.virgula.uol.com.br/wanessa-choca-fas-com-previas-de-musicas-novas-bem-diferentes/|title=Wanessa choca fãs com prévias de músicas novas BEM diferentes|published=Popline|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> At the time she entered the studio to record her eighth album again, this time under the new genre chosen, bringing Eduardo Pepato as producer, the same as the work of [[Luan Santana]] and Thaeme & Thiago.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://ego.globo.com/famosos/noticia/2016/06/wanessa-sobre-nova-fase-musical-descobri-o-romantico-de-volta.html|title=Wanessa sobre nova fase musical: 'Descobri o romântico de volta'|published=Glogo|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref>
According to Wanessa, the decision to change the musical genre was based on the personal identification of the country music: "The way of pop I do not identify myself, it is not my beach, my footprint is romanticism and the sertanejo is a strong mark of my I'm doing what I believe."<ref>{{citar web|url=http://portalpopline.com.br/nao-me-identifico-com-o-caminho-do-pop-no-brasil-diz-wanessa-camargo/|title=“Não me identifico com o caminho do pop no Brasil”, diz Wanessa Camargo|published=Popline|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> In the same week she breaks with [[Sony Music]] and signs with Work Show, producer responsible for releases of the sertanejo market.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://portalpopline.virgula.uol.com.br/apostando-em-nova-sonoridade-wanessa-camargo-quebra-contrato-com-sony-music/|title=Apostando em nova sonoridade, Wanessa Camargo quebra contrato com Sony Music|published=Popline|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> On July 26, she released the first single from the album, "Coração Embriagado", which reached the nineteenth position on [[Billboard Brasil|''Billboard'' Brasil]], being the best result of her career until then.<ref>{{citar web|URL=https://ia601509.us.archive.org/15/items/billboardbrasilhot10020160815/Billboard_Brasil_Hot_100_20160815.pdf|title=Billboard Brasil - Hot 100 Airplay|published=[[Billboard Brasil]]. [[Internet Group]]|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> "Vai que Vira Amor" was released as a promotional single on August 26.<ref>{{citar web|URL=http://www.hugogloss.com/index.php/music/wanessa-camargo-vem-com-tudo-sertanejo-ouca-novas-coracao-embriagado-e-vai-que-vira-amor/|title=Wanessa Camargo vem com tudo no sertanejo! Ouça as novas “Coração Embriagado” e “Vai que Vira Amor”|published=Hugo Gloss|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref><ref name=vqvalanca>{{citar web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/br/album/vai-que-vira-amor-single/id1146175201|título=Vai Que Vira Amor - Single|published=iTunes|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> On August 19 she released her eighth studio album, titled ''[[33 (Wanessa album)|33]]''.<ref>{{citar web|URL=http://portalpopline.virgula.uol.com.br/wanessa-camargo-libera-album-novo-para-streaming-gratuito/|title=Wanessa Camargo libera álbum novo para streaming gratuito|published=Popline|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref><ref>{{Citar web|url=http://vejasp.abril.com.br/materia/eduardo-pipato-produtor-sertanejo|title=Eduardo Pepato, o produtor do momento no mercado de música sertaneja|work=|published=VEJA São Paulo|last=Izquierdo|first=Tatiana}}</ref> The work received harsh criticism, with the singer being called "[[Selling out]]" and "without musical identity" by the musical critics.<ref name="g1">{{citar web|url=http://g1.globo.com/musica/blog/mauro-ferreira/post/album-sertanejo-de-wanessa-volta-com-bonus-e-o-mesmo-tom-artificial.html|title=Álbum sertanejo de Wanessa volta com bônus e o mesmo tom artificial|published=[[Grupo Globo|G1]]|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref><ref>{{citar web|url=http://observatoriog.com.br/opiniao/2017/03/a-falta-de-identidade-musical-de-wanessa-camargo-e-o-oportunismo-do-album-33|title=A falta de identidade musical de Wanessa Camargo e o oportunismo do álbum "33"|author=Faustino, Emílio|accessdate=2011-02-07|published=Portal [[iG]]}}</ref>
==Musical characteristics== {{Double image|right|Celine Dion Concert Singing Taking Chances 2008.jpg|160|ShaniaTwain3.jpg|160|[[Celine Dion]] (left) and [[Shania Twain]] (right) are two of Wanessa's main influences.|alt=Two pictures; the first shows a woman with plaited hair, blue eyes and red lipstick wearing a colorful dress and guitar strap. The second shows a man smiling; he has brown hair and wears a suit jacket and vest, and a white shirt open at the collar. His blue tie is not fastened.}}
===Influences=== Wanessa had influences of romantic music during the course of her career, citing [[Celine Dion]], [[Shania Twain]] and [[Mariah Carey]] as three of her great references.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.terra.com.br/exclusivo/noticias/2002/12/05/008.htm|title=Mariah Carey grava show para o Fantástico ao lado de Sandy|work=Terra|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref><ref name=ego2016>{{citar web|url=http://ego.globo.com/famosos/noticia/2016/07/wanessa-e-apresentada-por-novo-empresario-em-goiania.html|title=Wanessa é anunciada por empresário sertanejo: 'Voltando às raízes'|published=Globo|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> In her early albums, she also sought inspiration from [[country pop]] artists, noting Shania as well as [[Dixie Chicks]] and [[Faith Hill]] - the latter two who reissued the tracks "[[Not Ready to Make Nice]]" and "[[Breathe (Faith Hill song)|Breathe]]", respectively.<ref name=ego2016/><ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.universomusical.com.br/materia.asp?mt=sim&cod=po&id=170|title= Musas ‘teen’ aderem à moda do DVD |published=Universo Musical|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> The singer made a tour in partnership with her father, the ''Pai e Filha Tuor'', in which she sang several of her influences, including "[[From This Moment On (Shania Twain song)|From This Moment On]]" and "[[You're Still the One]]" by Shania.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://peggo.tv/dvr/wnJVTb9qyf4|title=Zezé di Camargo e Wanessa Camargo — Turnê Pai e Filha|work=Peggo|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> [[Rita Lee]] was another artist cited as important in the professional maturity of the singer, with whom she re-recorded the track "Coisas da Vida" for the album ''[[Meu Momento]]''.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://radioclickmix.com/news/wanessa-camargo-regrava-rita-lee-em-novo-disco|title=Wanessa Camargo regrava Rita Lee em novo disco|work=Radio Click Mix|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref>
In 2005, with her membership in pop music, Wanessa expanded her references, citing as influences [[Shakira]], [[Michael Jackson]] and [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] - which highlighted in an interview for [[Universo Online|UOL]] that her favorite songs were "[[Like a Prayer (song)|Like a Prayer]]" and "[[La Isla Bonita]]".<ref name=itpop>{{citar web|url=http://virgula.uol.com.br/musica/bipopb-wanessa-camargo-comenta-madonna-e-musicas-favoritas/|title=Wanessa Camargo comenta Madonna e músicas favoritas|work=It Pop|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref><ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.jcnet.com.br/Cultura/2013/09/parabens-com-wanessa.html|title=Parabéns com Wanessa!|work=JC Net|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref><ref name=ego2016/> In 2010, during an interview with ''Kboing'', she also cited [[Jay-Z]], [[Alicia Keys]], [[Beyoncé]], [[Lauryn Hill]], and [[Lady Gaga]] as part of their referral base.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.kboing.com.br/entrevistas/Entrevista-Wanessa+10031510193151.html|title=15 de março de 2010 - Entrevista: Wanessa|work=Kboing|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> In 2016, during an interview for the ''Programa do Porchat'', Wanessa mentioned other women of the genre, such as [[Paula Fernandes]], Maiara and Maraisa, Marília Mendonça and Naiara Azevedo, as references for the new phase of the career in the following of the sertanejo.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://entretenimento.r7.com/programa-do-porchat/fotos/em-entrevista-a-fabio-porchat-wanessa-camargo-conversa-com-sandy-e-esclarece-suposta-rivalidade-04102016#!/foto/1|title=Em entrevista a Fábio Porchat, Wanessa Camargo conversa com Sandy e esclarece suposta rivalidade|published=R7|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref>
===Musical style=== For most of her career Wanessa has devoted herself to [[country pop]], including other recurring musical genres such as [[pop music]] and [[dance-pop]] - from 2005. Some songs feature such specific genres as [[pop rock]] ("Sem Querer", "Não Resisto a Nós Dois"), [[reggaeton]] ("Me Engana que Eu Gosto, "Amor Amor"), [[forró]] ("Me Pega de Jeito"), [[dubstep]] ("Sticky Dougth"), [[arrocha]] ("Vai Que Vira Amor"), [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] ("Fly", "Não Me Leve a Mal").<ref>{{citar web|url=http://rollingstone.uol.com.br/edicao/12/voce-precisa-estar-preparado-para-nao-acontecer#imagem0|title="Você precisa estar preparado para não acontecer"|published=Rolling Stone|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> During a [[Grupo Globo|G1]] interview in 2013, the singer explained that she has always tried to keep Brazilian elements in the songs, as a [[funk carioca]] from Rio in "Sticky Dough."<ref>{{citar web|url=http://g1.globo.com/musica/noticia/2013/05/wanessa-lanca-dvd-e-critica-pirataria-vou-ter-que-fazer-musica-por-hobby.html|título=Wanessa lança DVD e critica pirataria: 'Vou ter que fazer música por hobby'|work=G1|acessodata=15 de novembro de 2015}}</ref> Her traditional genres were cast aside on album ''[[DNA (Wanessa album)|DNA]]'' in 2011, when Wanessa bet on a mix of [[Electronic dance music|EDM]], [[electronic music|electronic]] and [[electropop]], which was recorded entirely in [[English-language|English]], of the other albums.<ref>{{Citar web |url=http://portalpopline.com.br/wanessa-prepara-album-novo-revela-produtor/ |titulo=Produtor conhecido por Trabalhar com Wanbessa na Faixa ''Stuck On Repeat'' |trabalho=Popline |author= |data=20 de outubro de 2014 |accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref> In 2016, Wanessa made a redirection of race, directing itself to the sertanejo, predominant in the album ''33''.<ref>{{Citar web |url=http://www.folhamax.com.br/curiosidades/wanessa-camargo-troca-pop-pela-musica-sertaneja/94560|published=Folha Max|title=Wanessa Camargo troca pop pela música sertaneja|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref>
===Voice=== Wanessa has a vocal type classified as [[Mezzo-soprano]], which covers a vocal extension of 3.2 octaves. The biggest highlights of her voice are her falsettos and chest voice, in addition to being able to perform high and extensive notes. Her longest notes are in the songs "Não Me Leve a Mal" and "Eu Estarei Aqui", where it reaches 16 seconds in both.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.discopunisher.com/2012/05/lista-as-extensoes-vocais-das-divas-do.html|title=Notas Mais extensas|work=Disco Punisher|accessdate=2011-02-07}}</ref>
==Personal life== In 1998, at age 16, she was the initial target of the [[kidnapping]] that ended up by mistake with her Uncle Welington Camargo, who mobilized the country when they cut a piece of her ear and sent it to the family.<ref>[http://bombeirosanjosdavida.com.br/segunda_entrada/revista/6edicao/conteudo/teoriaesfericadaprotecao.php Sequestro de Wellington Camargo tinha como foco inicial Wanessa] Bombeiros Anjos da Vida</ref> Soon after, even with security hired, suffered a new attack when its college was assaulted.<ref name="Veja 2003"/> After the raid her family moved to the city of [[Plantation, Florida]], in the [[United States]], to protect herself of future attacks, where she remained for a year.<ref name="Veja 2003"/> In 2003 Wanessa revealed in an interview for ''[[Veja (magazine)|Veja]]'' magazine that she had not been a virgin for some time.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://origin.veja.abril.com.br/260203/entrevista.html|title="Sou o oposto da Sandy"|work=Veja|archivedate=2013-12-31}}</ref> But her parents still did not know and, days later, Zezé was questioned in an interview about this and said he was surprised by the news to know immediately.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.terra.com.br/exclusivo/noticias/2003/02/24/009.htm|title=Zezé di Camargo descobre que Wanessa não é mais virgem lendo revista|work=Terra|archivedate=2013-12-31}}</ref>
In 1998, during adolescence, Wanessa dated the singer Leandro Scornavacca, member of [[KLB]], finishing a year later when it moved to the United States.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.oocities.org/faclubedoklb/entrevista.htm|title=Entrevista: Aqui você saberá mais sobre os meninos KLB , kiko 21 , Leandro 19 e Bruno 16 . Os garotos foram entrevistados e não fugiram a nenhuma pergunta das fãs|work=OO Cities|archivedate=2013-12-31}}</ref> In 2000 she began a relationship with the actor [[Dado Dolabella]], with whom she dated for two years, ending in 2002. In 2003 she had brief relationships with the actor Erik Marmo and with the singers Felipe Dylon and Rogério Flausino.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.terra.com.br/exclusivo/noticias/2003/04/23/034.htm|title=Wanessa Camargo não esconde romance com Erik Marmo|work=Terra|archivedate=2013-12-31}}</ref><ref>{{citar six months.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.terra.com.br/exclusivo/noticias/2003/02/24/009.htm|título=Rodrigo Prado foi o genro mais querido de Zilú|work=Terra|archivedate=2013-12-31}}</ref> In 2005 web|url=http://extra.globo.com/famosos/tudo-sobre-casamento-de-wanessa-camargo-416488.html|title=Tudo sobre o casamento de Wanessa Camargo|work=Globo|archivedate=2013-12-31}}</ref> On June 18, 2011 Wanessa|work=Popline|archivedate=2013-12-31}}</ref>
==Activism== Wanessa is also the ambassador of the [[NGO]] [[Fundação SOS Mata Atlântica]], which is fighting for the preservation of the [[Atlantic Forest]]. Due to her efforts to promote the NGO and its goals, and also to work for the clean-up of the [[Tietê River]] in São Paulo, Wanessa was awarded the 2007 Pro-Social Prize at the My Nick Awards event,<ref>{{citar web|url=http://mundonick.uol.com.br/canal/especiales/meus_premios/07/|title=Wanessa na Uol|archivedate=2013-12-31|publisher=Uol}}</ref> and some time then received the title of Personality of the Year and JK Jewel from Cicesp. In 2012, the singer received a cache of $150,000 from an advertisement that was entirely donated to [[Unicef]].<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.tribunahoje.com/noticia/14429/entretenimento/2012/01/11/wanessa-doa-r-150-mil-recebidos-por-propaganda-na-revista-com-foto-do-filho.html|title=Wanessa doa R$ 150 mil recebidos por propaganda na revista com foto do filho|archivedate=2013-12-31}}</ref> As early as 2014, Wanessa donated the $50,000 fee she received from ''[[Caras (magazine)|Caras]]'' magazine to display her second child exclusively in the publication for social projects.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.purepeople.com.br/noticia/wanessa-doa-cache-de-r-50-mil-recebido-de-revista-para-projetos-da-unicef_a22342/1#lt_source=external,manual|title=Wanessa doa cachê de R$ 50 mil recebido de revista para projetos da Unicef|archivedate=2013-12-31|publisher=Uol}}</ref> On December 18, 2014, Wanessa makes a virtual pocket show with old songs and never sung before to lure fans into a campaign on behalf of a boy named Ryan, who suffers from [[Ondine syndrome]]. During the presentation, netizens could make their donations.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://portalpopline.com.br/wanessa-faz-pocket-show-virtual-com-musicas-antigas/|título=Wanessa faz pocket show virtual com músicas antigas e nunca cantadas antes|archivedate=2013-12-31|published=Popline}}</ref> In December 2015, Wanessa was appointed UN ambassador, committing herself to UNAIDS actions in the response to HIV and discrimination.<ref>{{citar web|url=http://odia.ig.com.br/diversao/celebridades/2015-12-03/wanessa-e-nomeada-embaixadora-da-onu-em-brasilia.html|title=Wanessa é nomeada embaixadora da ONU, em Brasília|archivedate=2013-12-31|published=O Dia}}</ref>

It is a posture of society that no longer fits in today's time."<ref>{{citar web|url=http://virgula.uol.com.br/musica/pop/ser-contra-gente-que-faz-amor-e-ridiculo-diz-wanessa-sobre-gays-e-daniela-mercury/#img=1&galleryId=590276|title=‘Ser contra gente que faz amor é ridículo’, diz Wanessa sobre gays e Daniela Mercury|archivedate=2013-12-31|published=UOL}}</ref> In 2011 Wanessa made a show at the 15th [[São Paulo Gay Pride Parade]] for an audience of 1 million LGBT”|archivedate=2013-12-31|work=Rio Music Conference}}</ref> After having her first child with businessman Marcus Buaiz, the singer was asked how she would handle if her son was gay: "I look the actions, in the love of our neighbor, in the compassion, love is God, love is greater than everything."<ref>{{citar web|url=http://www.opovo.com.br/app/divirta-se/2015/04/28/noticiasdivirtase,3429580/wanessa-camargo-defende-o-publico-lgbt-e-ganha-apoio-de-daniela-mercur.shtml|title=Wanessa Camargo defende o público '''Yll Rugova''' (born 1984) is a [[political activist]], [[information designer]] and [[typographer]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.designindaba.com/articles/interviews/true-type|title=True to type {{!}} Design Indaba|last=|first=|date=|work=[[Design Indaba]]|access-date=2017-05-10|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref> from [[Kosovo]]. As a political and social activist, he is known as one of the founders of the [[Strong Party]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ted.com/tedx/events/13184|title=TEDxTirana {{!}} TED.com|last=|first=|date=|website=[[TED (conference)|TED]]|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-05-10}}</ref> and initiator of a series of political and social events in Kosovo, including the [[2013 protests in Kosovo|2013 protests against KEK]] in Pristina.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://archive.kosovotwopointzero.com/en/article/398/did-you-pay-your-power-bill-this-month|title=Did you pay your power bill this month?|website=archive.kosovotwopointzero.com|language=en|access-date=2017-05-10}}</ref> In 2014 he was a candidate for Partia e Fortë during [[Kosovan parliamentary election, 2014|national elections]].<ref>[http://telegrafi.com/partia-e-forte-garon-me-64-kandidate-per-deputete/ Partia e Fortë garon me 64 kandidatë për deputetë, Telegrafi 2014]</ref>
He is a lecturer of graphic design at the [[University for Business and Technology]] in [[Pristina]]. In 2005 together with Visar Arifaj co-founded the communication agency [[Trembelat]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.presstoexit.org.mk/archive29/LectureAndPresentation/HTML_2007/DesigningContent.html|title=Public lecture and exhibition {{!}} Designing Content {{!}} Peet Pienaar (South African Republic) and NORM (Switzerland).|website=www.presstoexit.org.mk|access-date=2017-05-10}}</ref> Together with Arifaj, and other activists and artists from Kosovo he founded the satirical political party Strong Party. In 2013 the party won one seat in the local elections for the local assembly of the capital Pristina. He is also actively engaged as an outspoken [[atheist]], publishing articles and debating with religious conservatives on national and regional media. He was claimed as "the pope of atheism in Kosovo" by the national newspaper [[Gazeta Express]].
